episode_title: 813 - The One Where Chandler Takes a Bath
note: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is at the counter eating a bowl of Frosted Flakes.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right . It’s a new day. All that stuff about Rachel, you don’t feel that now . It was crazy ! You’re fine . You’re better than fine ! You are, as your friend Tony would say, Grrrreat ! Everything’s normal ! She’s just your friend Rachel ! Your friend Rachel . Your friend ! Rachel .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, sweetie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s your girlfriend, Rachel !

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is sitting on the couch watching TV as Monica comes out of the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you, are you high?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just had the most amazing bath.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? I don’t like baths.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, you like them with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, it’s not the bath I enjoy, it’s the wet, naked lady.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, baths are so relaxing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? What do you do? You just sit in there stewing in your own filth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How dirty do you think I am? I’m telling you, if you had some candles and some bubbles and some music, you would love it! It would take all of your stress away.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, it’s 2:00 on a Wednesday and I’m watching Road Rules , how stressed do you think I am?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Chandler, you got a minute? I-I really need to talk to you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Uh, yeah! Is this a cold pizza talk or a leftover meatloaf talk?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, neither.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, what’s up?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. It’s-it’s just…lately, I’ve been feeling… Okay, here’s what it is… (Pause) You know what? I feel a lot better, thanks! (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no, no you don’t, just come back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Okay. You and Monica, friends for a long time, and sure there are rules, but then you went to London. Oh, no, but that’s different. I mean, there are rules there, too! You know what I mean?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It was different for you guys! I mean, I mean, you were both in the same place, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In London?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. When Monica and I were in London, we were both in London.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what? This is a bad idea. Forget it. Forget it, and listen, do me a favor, this conversation was between you and me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If that.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch. Ross sits down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Oh, Ross, don’t forget, we have that doctor’s appointment tomorrow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, are you going to find out the sex of the baby?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, we talked about it. We don’t want to know. All we care about is that it’s happy and healthy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yep! Happy and healthy! And cute!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And smart!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Popular.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: With an aptitude for science.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you two talking about the same baby? Hey! Have you started off thinking of names yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! I’ve come up with a bunch of ideas!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? Me too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh huh! If it’s a girl, Phoebe, and if it’s a boy, Phoebo!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe. But it wouldn’t hurt to have a backup, you know? Uh, Rach-Rach, what were you thinking? (Gives her a look)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! I was thinking if it’s a girl, how about Sandrine? It’s French.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh. That’s a really pretty name for-for an industrial solvent.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay fine, what do you have?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, OK, it’s for a boy. Well, I know it’s a little out there, but…Darwin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, oh my God, our child will be beaten to death in the schoolyard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, by Sandrine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re just saying that ’cause I said no to your name!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m really, really not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How-how about you each get five vetoes?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That sounds fair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! I don’t think you’re going to need it though. Okay, check this out. If it’s a girl, Rain.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Veto.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rain? Hi. Hi, my name is Rain. I have my own kiln, and my dress is made out of wheat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know her! I bought homemade soap from her at a Dead show!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, how about, for a guy, Thatcher?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, why do you hate our child?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, you go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, James.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But only if it’s a girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, veto. How about—Ooh, I like Ruth! What about Ruth?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I’m sorry! Are we having an 89-year-old? How about Dayton?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Veto. Stewart?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Veto. Sawyer?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Veto. Helen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Veto.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is it me, or is veto starting to sound really good?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica comes from the bathroom as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Boy, do I have a surprise for you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sex on the balcony?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, but someone’s really not going to get over that idea, are they?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I drew you a bath!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, I don’t like baths! Could you draw me a picture of us having sex on the balcony?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, could you just try it for me? Come on, I used all my best stuff! I-I-I lit some candles. I put on some music. I used bath salts, plus bubble bath! And got you this little plastic Navy ship. So it’s a boy bath!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, this does butch it up a bit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear, if you try it, you will love it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, if I do this, can we at least discuss sex on the balcony?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Absolutely.
(Chandler runs into the bathroom)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bet I know how that discussion’s going to go.
[Cut to Chandler laying in the bathtub. “Only Time,” is playing in the background.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, this isn’t so bad . I like the flower smell ! Which is okay, because I’ve got my boat .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I told you you were a bath person! Hey, when you get out, maybe I can give you a facial!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m going to need a bigger boat.

content.description: The Doctor’s Office, the doctor is writing something as Rachel is on the table, and Ross is standing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think you had an open mind about the name Ruth. I mean, come on, little Ruthie Geller, how-how cute is that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh my God! I can practically hear the mahjong tiles!

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: Okay! All your tests look fine. Now, are you two interested in knowing the sex of the baby?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, no. No, we’re not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But you have it right there in that file? You could tell us whether it’s a boy or a girl? Dayton or Sandrine? Phoebe or Phoebo?

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: That’s right. But if you don’t want to know…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, we want to wait, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right. Right.

content.speaker: Dr. Long
content.text: Oh, I’ll be right back. And, uh, I know it’s really not my place, but please don’t name your child Phoebo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, which of these babies do you think is the ugliest?
content.parenthetical: looking at the bulletin board with baby pictures

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Rach! Come on, that’s terrible! They’re…uh…they’re babies. They’re-they’re all beautiful.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Third one from the left?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, why is it staring at me? I think it knows I’m talking about it. (Rachel starts to peek at the file) Don’t-don’t you—Wh—Wha—Hey!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re looking!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I saw you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay fine, I did. But I didn’t see anything, I swear.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shame on you! Ugly baby judges you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but Ross just listen to me…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no, no! Don’t tell me! I don’t want to know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I couldn’t even if I wanted to, because I don’t know! I swear; I didn’t see anything, and I don’t want to know! It was just a momentary lapse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Momentary lapse. Don’t-don’t you have any self-control?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, a couple months late on the lecture, Ross.

content.description: Chandler and Monica’s, Monica is entering.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m in the bathroom, can you come in here? I think there’s something wrong.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? I-I think I’ll wait out here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m in the bathtub.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. (She goes into the bathroom.) What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I drew my own bath, but I did it wrong! The water’s tepid. The salt didn’t dissolve and is now… lodged places. And the scents I used don’t compliment each other. Eucalyptus and chamomile—Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The bath salts! They’re starting to effervesce! It’s different. (Pause) It’s interesting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, let’s talk about something else.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! Sure, sure. So, what was going on with you today? Oh-oh-oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I actually had the weirdest conversation with Joey. He was talking about rules and right and wrong and…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I had the exact same conversation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You did? What was he talking about?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know! Joey hasn’t had this much trouble getting out words since we saw him in Macbeth !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was a long night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, let’s break this down. What exactly did he say to you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, he was talking about rules.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, and looking at people differently.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He didn’t say anything about that to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did he tell you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He was asking all these questions about you, me, and London. And, of course the glue that holds this all together, the rules.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. So you, me and London. Looking at people differently. Maybe he wants to do what you and I did in London with someone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But what did he mean by rules?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute! He stopped talking the minute Phoebe came in!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because he was looking at her differently.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Phoebe is his friend, so he thinks that would be breaking the rules!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My God! He wants to do it with Phoebe in London!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just a minute! (To Chandler) That’s Mrs. Tribbiani!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t say anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would I say anything? That two of our best friends could start the greatest love affair of their lives! And they would have me to thank, and we could all start having babies?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not going to let you say anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just stay here! (Dumps a jar of bath salts in the bathtub)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, God!
(Monica runs out to Phoebe, who is in the kitchen)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, Monica, I brought back your iron.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you had that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought I lost it. I got a new one, like, a month ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, just as well, I broke this one.
(Monica starts smiling)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, I-I, I really shouldn’t say. I mean, I’m really not supposed to.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a humdinger!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then it’s really too bad that you can’t tell me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Somebody likes you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is it Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, then tell him to stop staring!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! Joey?! You don’t say.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it something you’d be interested in?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t know, I don’t know. You know, I mean, on the one hand, Mother may I? But y’know on the other hand… No. No, I can’t. We’re friends. No, oh, no. I don’t want to risk what we have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess that makes sense. So, you think you’re going to talk to him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure, yeah. I mean, it’s Joey. I don’t want him to get hurt. Well, I must say, I am on fire! First Chandler, now Joey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not Chandler, just Joey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.description: Central perk, Ross is sitting on the chair as Rachel walks in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what? I’ve been thinking about it. I’m really coming around on the name Ruth. I think I would actually consider naming our child that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, I-I can’t tell you how-how much that means to me! Ohh… Wait a minute. Wait a minute. You-you hated the name Ruth! Why-why would you change your mind? Unless, you know we’re never going to have to use it. You did see the folder. You know it’s a boy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t see anything! I actually changed my mind about the name.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think so! You’re just giving me Ruth so you’ll get to name it when it’s a boy, and that’s when you’ll swoop in and name him Heath or Blaine or Sequoia.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I would—Sequoia?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Veto.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Unless… (Rachel groans.) You anticipated that I would figure all this out and you know that it actually is a girl, and you really do want her to be named Ruth! Well, I’m not falling for that! Okay? Ruth is off the table!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Ross, you want the name Ruth!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not like this!

content.description: Rachel and Joey’s, Joey is sitting on his recliner as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. Well, what’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, Joey, I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I knooow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whaaat?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know about your feelings.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God. You do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and I’m sorry. I-I know things worked out for Chandler and Monica, but that’s very rare.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. I know. And this is so much more complicated than it was for those guys. I mean, it’s Rachel for God sakes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: For God sakes, it’s Rachel!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. I know. And she’s not only my friend; she’s my pregnant friend! She’s my pregnant friend who’s Ross’ ex!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that’s Rachel. (To herself) Beat me over the head with it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What am I going to do? You know, and I keep, I keep trying to get rid of these feelings, y’know? I stayed up all last night and made a list of everything I don’t like about her. You want to hear it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She made me switch to light Mayo. That’s it! That’s all I got! And, you know what? It tastes the same and my pants fit better!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey, I just think you’re getting worked up over nothing. This is probably just a crush.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Absolutely! Y’know, you get this rush of feelings, but then it goes away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, just a crush! That’s all this is! It’s a crush! I’m Joey; I don’t get deep feelings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right, there you go! Crushes happen all the time! I know I’ve had them for all you guys. Well, except for Ross and Chandler. And I’m sure you’ve had them for us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mm-hmm. (To herself) Throw me a bone here.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is on the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I uh… I called the doctor and now we both know the sex of the baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right. The student has become the master.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I swear, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on, you know it’s a girl!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A what?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You really didn’t know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re having a girl?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s what you just said!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You said girl!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. I’m… I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not! We’re having a girl! Sometimes I can’t believe it’s with you—But still! We’re having a girl!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know! I know. You know what? I’m putting Ruth back on the table!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yes! We’ll have ourselves a little baby Ruth…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Permission to veto.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, please.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler enters as Monica comes from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do I smell essential oils?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’m going to take a bath. I’m just going to get a magazine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(As soon as Monica leaves the room, Chandler takes off his jacket and runs to the bathroom. Monica enters the bathroom to find Chandler in the bathtub.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you think you’re doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: L-leaving my troubles behind?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know that you’re new at this, but this is completely unacceptable bath decorum.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s so hard to care when you’re this relaxed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine, you can have the bath, but I am taking your boat. Now you’re just a girl in a tub!
(Phoebe enters the bathroom)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, Bubbles. Manly. Well, I just thought I would drop by and let you know how it went with Joey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You told her?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She pulled it out of me! She’s like a conversational wizard! How’d it go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you were wrong, he doesn’t like me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! How would you like it if I sent you to Lee Majors’ house and told you that he liked you, and you went down there and you found out that he didn’t like you? How would you feel?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t think I’d care.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? Lee Majors is hot!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re in the bathroom!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because it’s a relaxing and enjoyable time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you guys doing in here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! A friend he’s looking at differently, but it’s wrong. It’s Rachel!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You like Rachel?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s no big deal, okay? Phoebe and I talked about it. It’s just a crush! It’s going to go away! (Looks down) Dude, you gotta rearrange your bubbles! Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: (To Monica) Mazel tov.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Ross and I were looking for you! What are we all doing in here? (Looks at Chandler) Oh, my! (Covers the spot where Joey wants bubbles to be replaced.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, cover it up with the boat!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes we’re all in here and we would love for you to join us!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well hey! What’s going on? Ooh, cool boat—(Sees why the boat’s there)—Oh, no. (Averts his eyes by looking around the room) (To Rachel) Hey, did you, did you tell them?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I was waiting for you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Tell us what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re having a girl.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, wow! Yay! Wow! Hooray! Oh, man!
(They all hug and then turn and look at Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll…I’ll get you later!

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting at the counter eating Cocoa Puffs.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right . It’s a new day, and it’s just a crush, that’s all ! Just a little crush ! All that worrying I was doing, that was crazy . Crazy ! Like my friend here the bird would say, ” it was cuckoo !” Everything’s going to be fine. It’s just a crush.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, sweetie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I love you.

content.description: Chandler and Monica’s bathroom. Both are sitting on opposite ends of the bathtub.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It sure is nice to do this together, isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. And what you’re doing feels so good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not touching you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s the salts.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, sweet Lord. New realms of pleasure!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whatever keeps you off the balcony, big guy!
